title: [$500] Web -The 'Sign Out' button is not visible when a user navigates to it using the Tab key and attempts

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Help Wanted

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

comments.body: Triggered auto assignment to @sonialiap (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync
Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @robertKozik (`External`)
Not sure what this is about. `Shift+Space` is for scrolling up while `Space` alone is scrolling down. The OP works as expected.

This is expected behavior. Shift+Space will scroll up. Since the sign-out button is at the bottom of the page, scrolling up will naturally bring the sign-out button out of view. The back handler API detects hardware button presses assigned to backward navigation in the search history. The error shown in the video isn't related to this issue. I have a proposal for changing this behavior if you'd still like to. The default behavior could be changed by adding custom logic to the shift+space scroll event. Essentially it'll have to be programmed to not scroll in the context when the focus is on the sign-out button. This could be implemented in JavaScript. One other solution if you don't want to go that route would be to modify the CSS of the sidebar so that it adjusts the size of all the buttons/text based on screen size in such a way that no scroll bar is ever needed. No JavaScript would be needed for this method.

To address this issue of the 'Sign Out' button not being accessible via keyboard navigation and scrolling, I can utilize JavaScript to handle keyboard events and scroll behavior to ensure the 'Sign Out' button becomes visible when navigating using the Tab key and scrolling with (Shift+)Space.There's a logic where it listens for keyboard events (Tab key and (Shift+)Space) and checks whether the 'Sign Out' button is visible within the viewport. If it's not visible, the code will display the button. I might need to adjust the logic or modify the event listeners to fit your specific use case or UI structure.
Additionally, customize the logic within the functions to focus or perform other actions based on your requirements.

Staging Behaviour Check https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/61146594/b450c31a-233a-4786-b9ff-61149876ef0e
@sonialiap In my opinion it's not a bug. Per Accessibility documentation `Shift + Spacebar` shortcut scrolls **UP** while `Spacebar` shortcut scrolls **DOWN**. I believe it's better to keep default behaviours intact to not shatter the accessibility.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.4.2.0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team **Slack conversation:** ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Log in with any account 3. On the Settings RHP resize windows so it is small enough so the scroll bar appears. Now focus on some button in the scroll view, and then try to scroll using the (Shift+)Space ## Expected Result: Sign out button should be visible when using (Shift+)Space ## Actual Result: The 'Sign Out' button is not visible when a user navigates to it using the Tab key and attempts to scroll using (Shift+)Space ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [ ] Android: Native - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: Native - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] Windows: Chrome / - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos Add any screenshot/video evidence https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/78819774/1983039e-69a7-4b6d-9079-ed8a9b3315ae [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
